![sketchup image](images/image17.png)
questions.answer: Inference
correctAnswer: Inference
options: Offset
Rise
Inference
Pull

questions.question: what is the Hybrid rendering option for in Layout?
questions.answer: It combines scalable vector linework with raster rendering for materials.
correctAnswer: It combines scalable vector linework with raster rendering for materials.
options: This option is used when there is more than one scale among multiple viewports on a page.
It combines scalable vector linework with raster rendering for materials.
It combines scalable vector linework with faster rendering speed.
There are not any rendering options in Layout.

questions.question: When some faces are oriented correctly and others are not, what is considered the most efficient way to correctly orient all faces?
questions.answer: Right-click a correctly oriented face and select orient Faces.
correctAnswer: Right-click a correctly oriented face and select orient Faces.
options: Select all geometry and choose orient Faces.
Hold the Shift key and select all backward faces, right-click the selection, and select Reverse Faces.
Right-click a correctly oriented face and select orient Faces.
Right-click each backward face and select Reverse Face.

questions.question: How do you sample a material that has been used in the model?
questions.answer: Activate the Paint Bucket tool, hold down Ctrl (Command), and then click the material that has already been applied to a face in the model.
correctAnswer: Activate the Paint Bucket tool, hold down Ctrl (Command), and then click the material that has already been applied to a face in the model.
options: In the Tools drop-down menu, select Material, right-click the material, and select Texture > Sample.
Activate the Paint Bucket tool, right-click the material, and select Texture > Sample.
Open the Materials window. Under the Colors In Model file, scroll down until you find the reference material, and then click the thumbnail.
Activate the Paint Bucket tool, hold down Ctrl (Command), and then click the material that has already been applied to a face in the model.

questions.question:
The cube on the bottom is in one group and the cube on top is in another group.How can you keep them in two separate groups,but have them appear as one when not selected?
![sketchup image](images/image18.png)
questions.answer: Hide the bottom edges in the top group and the top edges in the bottom group.
correctAnswer: Hide the bottom edges in the top group and the top edges in the bottom group.
options: Erase the bottom edges in the top group and the top edges in the bottom group.
Extrude both farther so that the geometry is overlapping.
offset the bottom of the top group and the top of the bottom group.
Hide the bottom edges in the top group and the top edges in the bottom group.

questions.question: How can you create a component that will always face your view?
questions.answer: when creating the component, select Face Me in the dialog box.
correctAnswer: when creating the component, select Face Me in the dialog box.
options: Right-click the component after creating it and select Always face camera from the menu.
when creating the component, select Face Me in the dialog box.
Right-click the component after creating it and select Face Me from the menu.
when creating the component, select Always face camera in the dialog box.
